fields.summary: Two identical issue created,while I clicked twice on "create" button. Disable or put grey color the button.

fields.description: There was an error using the date picker searcher when language is set to Greek. When the user selects any day of May and tries to search an invalid date format error is returned. The problem is that when the date is selected the js scripts incorrectly set the month to 'Μαι'. However, it is expected to be 'Μαϊ'. The fixed .js files are attached and are to be placed in atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.1.1/atlassian-jira/includes/js/calendar/lang , replacing the old ones.
fields.summary: Date picker i18n issue navigator searching error

fields.description:
When printing an issue with a list of sub-task, the green checkmark for resolved sub-tasks are not printed. I guess, this is because you include the accept.png as a bakcground image, which are by default not printed.

Because the green checkmark is very helpful, please fix this bug.

You can look at the status, but that is not the same. The green checkmark is more prominent.
fields.summary: Green checkmark for resolved sub-tasks not printed
The control of the calendar widget always highlight the value that has been currently set

fields.description:
As of JIRA 4.3.1 we are upgrading Tomcat to 6.0.32. In the same time we seem to change Tomcat's binary package for *Windows* from {{apache-tomcat-6.0.20.zip}} to {{apache-tomcat-6.0.32-windows-x86.zip}}.

https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/internal/org/apache/tomcat/apache-tomcat/6.0.32/
http://archive.apache.org/dist/tomcat/tomcat-6/v6.0.32/bin/

This change introduce requirement for new way of configuring of HTTPS as Tomcat uses [Apache Portable Runtime (APR) based Native library for Tomcat|http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/apr.html]. 

{quote}
    Tomcat can use the Apache Portable Runtime to provide superior scalability, performance, and better integration with native server technologies. The Apache Portable Runtime is a highly portable library that is at the heart of Apache HTTP Server 2.x. APR has many uses, including access to advanced IO functionality (such as sendfile, epoll and OpenSSL), OS level functionality (random number generation, system status, etc), and native process handling (shared memory, NT pipes and Unix sockets).

    These features allows making Tomcat a general purpose webserver, will enable much better integration with other native web technologies, and overall make Java much more viable as a full fledged webserver platform rather than simply a backend focused technology.
{quote}

If this is intended change we should alter our docs to indicate and warn users. Pages such as release notes and [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] are just two possible candidates for the update.

As of JIRA 4.3.1 the HTTPS connector needs to be configured in a completely different way with help of OpenSSL:
{noformat}
<Connector port="443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
               maxThreads="150"
               enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
               acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
               SSLEnabled="true" 
               SSLCertificateFile="${catalina.base}/conf/localhost.crt"
               SSLCertificateKeyFile="${catalina.base}/conf/localhost.key" />
{noformat}
http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/apr.html#HTTPS
http://mircwiki.rsna.org/index.php?title=Configuring_Tomcat_to_Support_SSL

Moreover, we need to ensure that we are consistent across the boarder and JIRA's Linux distribution also uses Apache Tomcat Native.
fields.summary: Change of Tomcat binary package for Windows breaks HTTPS

fields.description:
I guess it would be good if you guys can add basic text editor features in comments, descriptions, etc. fields which can allow users to do formatting easily.

It is always easy for users to click a button on the toolbar and make the selected text a hyperlink instead of remembering shortcuts or click (?) bubble and see what combination to use. Similarly, selecting text and simply clicking Bold, Italic, etc. options in toolbar and formatting text is simple instead of remembering to prefix and postfix '*' to make text look bold.

These are some very basic things which should be handy on fields where user has to type.
fields.summary: Basic text editor & formatting options

fields.description: When an issue has many comments, especially very lengthy ones, it can be difficult to navigate through them all. It would be nice to have a Expand/Collapse all comments toggle available in the issue view screen.
fields.summary: Add button to collapse all comments

fields.description: On the profile page, there is the text "Teogewezen Open Meldingen per project" which should be "Toegewezen Open Meldingen per project"
fields.summary: Dutch translation issue: Teogewezen must be Toegewezen

(i.e. https://myserver/jira/browse/PROJECT-1234) It would be very helpful if this view could also contain
the related stories - much like linked issues is working today.

Basically the view that you get if you click on the epic link in the Greenhopper task board view, where you

fields.description:
Click on the *Workflows* screen in the Administration section.

Notice how the page automatically scrolls down to focus on the first form field for "Adding a new workflow". This is annoying since I'm more often than not going to the Workflows screen to view an existing workflow and not to add one.

You'll hopefully be fixing this in Ignite, but I just thought I'd formally register complaint here :)
fields.summary: When viewing the Workflows admin screen, the page scrolls down automatically to focus on the "add new workflow" field

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+Standalone+as+a+Service

However, latest release reverted it back to the tomcat default name:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24473].
  {panel}

Lack of referential integrity in online calculator.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open online calculator.
2. Alternately insert numerals from 0 to 9. (0123456789)

Expected result:
1. Dialog box shows 0123456789

Actual result:
1. Dialog box shows 4930715286 (see pic. calculator.jpg)
fields.summary: Lack of correspondence in referential integrity

fields.description:
Creating or updating a number of issues to which I am assigned, have reported, or am otherwise on the notification list for produces a deluge of unnecessary notification emails that I don't need (I know these changes have been made: I made them).  Consequently, it is very easy for useful notifications created by others to be lost or disregarded in the flood of emails that I assume I have created and therefore pay little attention to.

It would be very useful to have an option to exclude the person who created or edited an issue from notification lists so that users only receive notifications that are a result of changes made by others.  Notifying a user of his own changes just because he matches a particular role is pointless noise.
fields.summary: Notification schemes should provide an option for the user whose action prompted a notification to be excluded from the notification list
lAST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24470].
  {panel}

When issues are assigned to >1 version and grouped in gadget by *Fix for Versions* field, Total counts all versions.
See screen-shots -
* *4.3.3* & *Bugfix Release* are the same issues, as result *Total Issues* shows wrong number whereas
* Issue navigator show correct number
fields.summary: "Issue Statistics" gadget shows wrong total number of issues

fields.description:
Upgrade a JIRA 3.9 with Activity time logged on an Issue to Jira 4.3
Secure that the user has permission the schema the issue is and permissions to change own and others activity logs
Try to find the edit Activity icon to the right of the log entry, on the Activity time log that came from the legacy version.

Prior to the upgrade it was possible just to include a "-" in front of a time entry, and the logged sum on the issue would be reduced. When we try using this procedure, we get an error message, "Invalid time duration entered"
fields.summary: Not possible to reduce time registeret in Activity time log prior to update to Jira 4.3 upgrade from 3.9

fields.description:
When v4.3.2 is still installed (as Windows service) the v4.3.3 installer fails to install a new service.

The reason is as follows:
In all previous versions the service's DisplayName was _Atlassian JIRA 4.x.x_ and a new installer would simply add another service with a new version number.
For some reason this has been changed in v4.3.2, the Display Name is now _Apache Tomcat 6_. As a result, when a new installer tries to install a new service, this fails because a service with that DisplayName already exists.

h3. Workaround 1

Update the service name as per the attached screenshot. The service name comes from the existing service.

h3. Workaround 2

Rename the v4.3.2 service in the registry:
{code}HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\JIRA260411164010\DisplayName = Atlassian JIRA 4.3.2{code}
(On my machine this setting did not take immediate effect, I had to open and close the service's properties in the control panel first)
After that, the v4.3.3 installer can successfully install the new service.
fields.summary: Update to v4.3.3 is unable to install as service when v4.3.2 service is still installed

fields.description:
The customer uses the 2 dimensional filter. for all open issues. The filter displays one open unscheduled issue but when you click on it it says there are no matches.
During my investigation I found that the count is caused by 1 specific issue. There appeared nothing wrong with the issue. tried moving it and moving back without any success. Only way to remove the count in the filter is to close the issue.
fields.summary: the 2 dimensional filter displays a wrong value in the unscheduled column

fields.description:
Upgrade Task Build 602 updates the "Membership" sequence used by the new "cwd_membership" table

in line 284 {code}updateSequence(connection, "Membership", "cwd_membership");{code} at the end of the migrateUsers method. 

This is wrong as we haven't migrated the memberships to the new table yet, this call should have really been done at the end of the migrate memberships method.

Currently we will leave the value of the "Membership" at 10, as we add more memberships the value generated by the sequence will collide with the rows produced by membership migration turning into a primary key constraint violation. 

This will prevent more memberships from being added to JIRA.

The workaround to the problem will be manually update the sequence using SQL so that the value of the sequence equals _select max(id) from cwd_membership_  + 1
fields.summary: Upgrade Task Build 602 leaves the Membership sequence in an inconsistent state

fields.description:
I need an easy way to see if my parent issues are in progress or not at a glance.  

Many of us use sub tasks (or sub bugs) to break down tasks on a parent story or bug.   If one of the sub tasks (or sub bugs) is in progress I want greenhopper to change the status of the parent item to in progress.  It makes no sense for a sub-issue to be in progress (or resolved) and show the parent item as just "open".  If work is being done on one of the sub-issues, of course the parent item is in progress.  As a nice to have,  if all of the sub-issues are closed, then the parent should at least be "resolved".

Right now there seems to be no way to even indicate a story or bug with sub-issues is in progress.  The only way to do it is look at their sub-issues which is laborious.
fields.summary: If a sub-issue is in progress, the parent item should automatically move to 'In progress'
Issue Type Scheme Migration - Display Progress Page
Don't log warning when installing a plugin
Problem with the update of timespent and timeestimate

fields.description:
When we updated our in-house continuous integration system to use Maven 3 instead of Maven 2, we discovered that one of the plugins was not written in a way that would allow it to function in a Maven 3 environment.  Below is the debug output of the build failure.

I'd very much appreciate it if this could be remedied.  There is really no reason that we've seen that would require us to support both Maven 2 (or the 'JIRA SDK') and Maven 3 in our system.  Our system builds many different Maven applications and plugins and this is the only plugin that we are blocked on.  :(

Is there a plan to have this fixed in the future?  If so, please give me a rough idea as to when.  If not, can I be provided with the source to see if I can submit a patch to fix this?

{noformat}

fields.description:

Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page
Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   3. attach the application server log file ( C:\Users\Kah Loun\JIRA\atlassian-jira-4.3.1-standalone\home\log\atlassian-jira.log )

Stack Trace: [hide]

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Start up a clean JIRA 4.3.x instance
# Go to _Administration -> System -> Plugins_ page
# Click on Upgrade tab and you will be able to see JIRA FishEye Plugin in there 
# Click on Download button and we will see something like *"JIRA FishEye Plugin" cannot be installed by the UPM. Visit the plugin homepage to read the installation instructions:*
# After downloading the latest plugin version *3.1.5*, shut down JIRA 4.3.x instance
# Place the plugin inside <JIRA_43x_Home>/plugins/installed-plugins/ directory
# Start up JIRA
# After the JIRA server startup, these error messages will be shown:
{noformat}
...
2011-04-11 13:09:12,159 main ERROR      [osgi.container.felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager] JarContent: Unable to read bytes.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: zip file closed
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.ensureOpen(ZipFile.java:416)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.getEntry(ZipFile.java:161)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.getEntry(JarFile.java:208)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.util.JarFileX.getEntry(JarFileX.java:61)
...
2011-04-11 13:09:12,161 main ERROR      [atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl] There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event 'com.atlassian.jira.extension.JiraStartedEvent@27f6f3d1' from the invoker 'com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker@172a45c9'.
java.lang.RuntimeException: com/opensymphony/module/propertyset/PropertySet
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$2.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1.execute(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:28)
...
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/opensymphony/module/propertyset/PropertySet
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.FishEyePropertiesImpl.getText(FishEyePropertiesImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.FishEyePropertiesImpl.getText(FishEyePropertiesImpl.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin.config.FishEyeConfigImpl.validateConfiguration(FishEyeConfigImpl.java:135)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.PropertySet
	at org.apache.felix.framework.ModuleImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(ModuleImpl.java:772)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.ModuleImpl.access$200(ModuleImpl.java:73)
...
{noformat}
# Going over to _Administration -> System -> Plugins_, JIRA Fisheye Plugin has been successfully upgraded to 3.1.5. To counter-check, clicking at the Upgrade tab does not show JIRA FishEye Plugin anymore. This shows that the FishEye plugin got upgraded successfully but still throwing some errors in the startup logs. 

(i) JIRA FishEye plugin (3.1.2) is already bundled together in JIRA 4.3.x. 

It looks like the newest version of the FishEye plugin is relying on some classes that are not what they used to be in. It should not be a problem after replacing a bundled plugin with a more recent version. 

h5. Workaround

Please refer to [this comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24453?focusedCommentId=307818&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-307818].
fields.summary: Unable to read bytes error on JIRA startup

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce the problem:
# Log in to JIRA
# Click on Projects tab
# Under this page, click on Quick Create Issue (opening Summary tab by default) and it is able to show Project and Issue type options correctly

*Using Firefox 3.6.16*
- Switch tab upon the first time and click on the Quick Create Issue box will appear as empty without showing Project and Issue type options:
!Firefox3.6.16.png|thumbnail!


*Using Firefox 4*
- Switch tab until the second time and click on the Quick Create Issue box will appear as empty without showing Project and Issue type options:
!Firefox4.jpg|thumbnail!

*Using IE 8*
- No problem at all after switching tab and clicking on the Quick Create Issue box

It appears that IE 9 is also having the same problem after further replication even though it is still not a supported web browser yet. Anyway, this problem will go away after refreshing the page. 

In previous JIRA versions (JIRA 4.2 and earlier), this problem does not happen.
fields.summary: Quick Create Issue box empty after switching between tabs under Projects

fields.description:
I think Jonathan cloned an issue from CONFDEV into another project CONFEXT. But for some reason I got a en email notification saying the issue was created in CONFDEV. When I go to the issue link in the email, it takes me to CONFEXT.

The 2 issues are:

CONFDEV-4105
CONFEXT-2

Email content:
{noformat}
Selecting empty table cells causes cursor to be positioned at top of page
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

                Key: CONFDEV-4146
                URL: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-4146
            Project: Confluence Development
         Issue Type: Bug
         Components: SuperSonic Hedgehogs
   Affects Versions: 4.0, 4.0-m21, 4.0-m21-Hedgehogs
           Reporter: Nabeelah Ali [Atlassian]
        Attachments: cursorjumpie8.swf

{color:red}*This bug is derived from TinyMCE and can be reproduced in the [TinyMCE demo|http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/tryit/full.php]*{color}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Start editing a page
# Create a table
# Without adding any content to the cells, select two or more cells

*Expected behaviour*
The cells are selected and the cursor is positioned in one of the cells.

*Actual behaviour*
The cells are selected and the cursor jumps to the top of the page.

See video for an example.
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA emails report that an issue was created in the wrong project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24450].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Setup a new instance of JIRA.
2. Login as Sysadmin. Goto admin page and there is no project right now.
3. Click on "Add Project". 

Result:
1. User is asked to enter password.
2. As a user first time setting JIRA, this is not very user friendly experience.
fields.summary: User should n't be shown the websudo dialog when creating project in JIRA for first time

fields.description:
Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses.

Currently, Oracle will not accept a query which contains an IN clause with more than 1000 elements. 

You will get an exception in the logs that looks like

com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following: [ _query here_ ] (ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

We should change the oracle dialect so that this doesn't happen. There are two alternatives:

1. Batch IN clauses that contain more than 1000 elements. This is less risky but could cause performance issues (There's a reason to these limits in Oracle). A fix like this might be suitable for a point release, because we would only batch when we got to more than 1000 elements and only oracle databases, so the amount of customers affected by the change would be relatively small.

2. Generate sub-queries instead of IN clauses. This is technically more correct and will probably perform better. This is a more risky change, we could reduce the risk by generating sub-queries only when we have more than 1000 elements. This should probably be done as part of a full release to allow more time for testing and dogfooding.

Both fixes should only be done for Oracle database to limit the impact.
fields.summary: Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses

fields.description: see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.3.3+Release+Notes

The plugin is not currently in active development, but is a vital feature for numerous customer instances and we are currently working to find a solution that will make this feature set available once more.
fields.summary: Status of the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin in 4.3

fields.description:
These steps were taken based on [How to create a custom preset filter|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+create+a+custom+preset+filter].

When setting a filter url to be used into a preset filter everything ran OK:

e.g.
{code}http://localhost:8080/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=10000&status=6&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC{code}

However, if you try to provide *pid* and *jqlQuery* parameters together in this same URL, the *pid* is ignored on search results regardless the value you set.

e.g.
{code}http://localhost:8080/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=$helper.project.id&jqlQuery=assignee+%3D+currentUser%28%29+AND+status+in+%28Open%2C+Reopened%29+ORDER+BY+key+DESC{code}

This behavior occurs in versions 4.0.1 and 4.3 (at least these are the versions I tested).

It can be replicated following the instructions on article above.
fields.summary: Parameter "pid" ignored when creating a custom preset filter

fields.description:
When upgrading to JIRA 4.3.x, The upgrade task UpgradeTask_Build602 also tries to migrate property sets on the OSGroup entity to the new Crowd Group entity. Unfortunately, the migration of the property set is only done half way since JIRA does not update the column entity_id in the propertyentry table to reflect the reference to the migrated group in cwd_group. So the entity_ids in propertyentry either refer to the wrong entry in cwd_group or even to a non existent entry and this is a bug in my opinion.

*A potential workaround is to Update the entity_id in propertyentry to refer to the correct cwd_group row*
fields.summary: Group propertysets not properly migrated when upgrading  to 4.3.x

fields.description:
# Goto an issue with a sub-task.
# Open the sub-task quick create.
# Add something to the summary.
# Cancel the form.
# (DEFECT) Reopen the sub-task quick create. Notice that the summary is still there even though I hit cancel.

I would expect cancel to clear the form. 

This behavior becomes more strange if you add the attachments field to the sub-task quick create. 

# Make sure the attachment field is on the sub-task quick create form (see {{jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields}})
# Goto an issue with a sub-task.
# Open the sub-task quick create.
# Upload an attachment.
# Cancel the form.
# (DEFECT) Reopen the sub-task quick create. Notice that the upload is still displayed there.
fields.summary: Sub-task quick create is not being cleared on cancel.

fields.description:
# Goto an issue with a subtask.
# Open the sub-task quick create.
# Type something into the "Summary"
# Click Cancel.
# (DEFECT) Click edit. Notice that a dirty form warning appears.

I would expect the cancel button to actually cancel my edit.

[^dirty_subtask_quick_create.mp4]
fields.summary: Get a "dirty form warning" from sub-task quick create even when the user chooses cancel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24433].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Change your browser/OS settings so that the tab key will focus links.
# Open a dialog with form fields inside it, e.g. log work. The first field is automatically focused.
# Press tab. The next form field (if one exists) is focused.
# GOTO 3.

Expected result:

At some point, the cancel link should be focused.

Observed result:

The cancel link never gets focus. Shift+tab, option+tab, etc. don't focus the cancel link either, even though they will focus other links, like date pickers, comment security level, etc.
fields.summary: Cannot focus cancel link with keyboard in dialogs

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Default language English (UK) at {{Administration >> Global Settings >> General Configuration}} and user profile
# Go to {{Administration >> Issue Settings >> Statuses >> Translate}}
# Translate the Status for German (Germany) or any other languages but it is not working. No matter what you type inside the field, your current default English translation will be used in the field. For example, insert "Test 1" and "Test 2" as name and description for 'Open' status
# After you have saved, change the default language at {{Administration >> Global Settings >> General Configuration}} to be German (Germany).
# "Test 1" and "Test 2" are not used as the name and description for 'Open' status
# If you want to translate other language, first you need to translate your default language before you translate the other as it will only take the translation of your default language as input. You can also change the language at {{Administration >> Global Settings >> General Configuration}} or user profile before the translation

This error happens to Issue Types, Priorities and Resolution Translations also
fields.summary: issue settings translation not working

fields.description:
The case against image lightboxes:

* You do not get image progressive loading
* large images take forever...no indication of progress
* You lose the browser's built-in ability to zoom and autoscale large images

Yes, you can right-click the image file and open in a new browser.  

Would be great if it just auto-opened in new tab/window on left-click.
fields.summary: Provide option to disable Image Lightbox
View Workflow in "More actions" menu shows empty window if workflow does not have a last modification date

fields.description:
Given the following situation:

    * Employees have left the company, and their email address is no longer valid
    * Their accounts in crowd have been marked as inactive, and they have been removed from all groups, thus they are no longer active users.
    * We can't delete the users since they are the Reporter/Assignee/etc. of many current and legacy issues.
    * When an issue they are the Reporter/Assignee on is updated in a way that a notification is generated, the email is bounced (since it is no longer valid) back to the project's email, a mailing list for the dev team.

Typically in our notification schemes, the Reporter and Current Assignee are notified upon updates. I do not want to remove these users from those designations.

It seems like it should be a trivial enhancement to simply either:

    * provide an option to not send email notifications to users that are not active, or
    * allow users (administrators only?) to enter a blank email and have the system not notify users without email addresses.
fields.summary: Provide means to disable e-mail notifications for a user.

fields.description:
The built in "Comment" field has useful properties; it is multi-valued, it tracks who authored and when.  But an issue can only have one field that is a "Comment" field, and the running log of comments won't display on custom screens (although data can be entered into that running log from custom screens.)

I have a project with multiple tabs of fields (in edit mode), and, I want a comment log on each tab, and I want the running log of prior comments to be visible below the new comment entry area, so that comments can be entered in context.

I propose a new custom field type "comment log".  A field created with that type could have an arbitrary name, there could be an arbitrary number of such fields, and they could be placed on screens just like any other custom field.
fields.summary: Create custom field type "comment log" that behaves like the built-in comment field but can be placed on screens as a custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24420].
  {panel}

Now that there are platform-specific installers for Windows and OSX, how about cleaning up what is packaged in the {{bin}} directory for Linux?
There are 13 .bat files that are just clutter in there.

{code}
[mdoar@mdoar2-3 bin]$ ls
bootstrap.jar         jsvc.tar.gz           startup.bat
catalina-tasks.xml    permgen.bat           startup.sh*
catalina.bat          permgen.sh*           tomcat-juli.jar
catalina.sh*          permgenservice.bat    tomcat-native.tar.gz
commons-daemon.jar    service.bat           tomcat6.exe
config.bat            setclasspath.bat      tomcat6w.exe
config.sh*            setclasspath.sh*      tool-wrapper.bat
cpappend.bat          setenv.bat            tool-wrapper.sh*
digest.bat            setenv.sh*            version.bat
digest.sh*            shutdown.bat          version.sh*
jirabanner.txt        shutdown.sh*
{code}
fields.summary: Clean up the bin directory for each platform

The Screenshot For Restoring a Project from Backup Documentation Should Be Updated To Avoid Confusion

fields.description:
We dont turn on SOAP/XML-RPC by default in JIRA however we do have REST and HTTP interactions on by default.  Why is this?  I think they should be on by default for all new instances and the unreasoably paranoid can turn them off.

This will allow stuff to just work by default such as Connectors and the like.
fields.summary: Ship JIRA with Remote API turned on by default.

fields.description:
Please come up with a cache for avatars.

I'm tempted to file this as a bug. 

Our Jira server crashed today ([JSP-78580|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-78580]). 
Looking through the stack traces of the thread dump, I see that 102 threads are locked reading the database.
9 of those 102 threads where locked reading avatar data.

This shocked me.
In our system the avatars rarely change - once a year if ever.  
10% of our locked threads certainly should not be spent on looking up avatars.
It should be 0%.
If there ever was a candidate for something that needs to be cached, avatars are it.

Looking at the code I see the interface {{AvatarStore}} has only one implementation: {{OfbizAvatarStore}}
whereas most animals like this have 2 implementations, an Ofbiz* and a Cached*Delegate.

Please come up with a cache for avatars.
fields.summary: cache avatar data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24414].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would have created a Bug issue type but by reading the thread of the original source of this issue (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-77183), I'm not sure... so here is it

For the _jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields_ line in _jira-application.properties_ the field issuetype need always to be present, otherwise it crashes.

May I make suggestions then:
* The comments before the line (in _jira-application.properties_) should state this (that issuetype is mandatory), so users/admin wouldn't have to guess which field was making the crash.
* Could there have been a message instead of a crash, or a better message in the crash?

Thank you very much,
Nancy
fields.summary: jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields line and field issuetype mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24411].
  {panel}

Different results are obtained when retrieving an issue via the REST api compared to XML.   Attached are the results obtained from the following two URLs:
* GET http://jira.atlassian.com/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/JRA-23969/JRA-23969.xml
* GET http://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/issue/JRA-23969

Observations:
* xml contains resolution, omitted from json (looking at other issues, I see that resolution is included in the json if the issue is actually resolved.   For unresolved issues, however, the value appears to be omitted)
* xml contains field values for Participants (customfield_10150), json contains no values for this field
* json contains values for "Support Request Message (IssueType:Bug)" (customfield_10250).  This field is shown in the xml with no corresponding ID and no value.
* json contains a field value for "Test Issue Creation Warning" (customfield_10301).  This field is shown in the xml with no value.
* json shows many more custom fields that aren't in XML (none appear to have a value associated with them, so perhaps that's why they're omitted?)
* json shows information about watchers; xml does not
* json shows fixVersion; xml does not unless there's a value
fields.summary: Issue retrieval via REST should be consistent with retrieval via XML

fields.description: Cross Domain restrictions blocks the browsers to access to the rest service <host>/rest/auth/latest/session and it doesn't allow ajax to access to the server. To know; with curl it's ok and it returns the json response as mentioned in this tutorial http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+REST+API+(Alpha)+Tutorial#JIRARESTAPI%28Alpha%29Tutorial-JIRARESTAPIOverview
fields.summary: Problem in the rest service of authentification <host>/rest/auth/latest/session

fields.description:
Currently JIRA only allows a user to create, release and generally manage versions in a project if the user is a project admin.
However there are numerous use cases where developers, release managers, project managers, etc. need to be able to perform this function but don't need full admin rights.
Adding this as a permission that can be assigned using a permission scheme seems to be a reasonable way to do this.
fields.summary: As a developer or release manager I want to be able to create and manage versions in JIRA without having to be given project admin permissions

fields.description:
At different points of the workflow the comment field can be displayed in a transition screen (i.e. investigation). Sadly this relationship is lost afterwards, there's no way to tie that comment to that step in the process.

I thought I was going to be able to copy that comment to a different field for easy retrieval later but found two issues:
1) Is not possible to retrieve comments from the screen
2) There's no field type big enough (255 is the biggest)

If there was a way to link the comments with the step it would be great (this probably means additional info on the database)

See: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-78285 for the support ticket that generated this request.
fields.summary: Post action to copy comment to a field
Improve semantic markup in User Browser table

fields.description: CrowdEmbedded is currently being excluded from the JIRA source distribution
fields.summary: Add CrowdEmbedded to JIRA source distribution

fields.description:
{quote}
Hello

We have a project with various security levels corresponding to different customer groups. This works well for use, but we would like the security level to not be visible to those who do not have the permission to edit it (i.e. the external users). I have used the Set Security Level Permission to ensure that only internal users can edit it, I have added the Security Level to the edit screen for the project/screen scheme, but not to the View screen. However the Security Level still appears in the View screen as seen, both by internal users and external users. Surely it should now only be seen in the edit screen, and then only by those with the permission to edit it?

Any help gratefully received.

many thanks

David

{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to hide Security Level field from users who cannot edit it

fields.description:

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Start the external import wizard for a CSV import
# Upload a file and create a new configuration
# Map some of the fields in the file to existing, distinct custom fields (make sure you have more than one custom field defined in your system)
# Advance through the wizard until you are able to download the configuration file
# Download the configuration file
# Cancel the wizard and restart
# Upload the configuration file and the same import file again

Upon reaching the field mapping screen, you will notice that for the fields which were mapped to existing custom fields, they are all mapped to the first custom field in the list.

See the screenshot for an example of what shows up in the UI, compared to this snippet of the configuration file that was generated:

{code}
field.signatory = customfield_10021
field.PSC_file = customfield_10003
field.corr_date = customfield_10004
field.corr_ref = customfield_10020
field.id = customfield_10022
field.ministry_desc = customfield_10000
field.assignee = assignee
field.cat_desc = customfield_10001
field.register_time = created
field.reporter = reporter
field.corr_desc = summary
{code}

Notice that the custom fields are distinct in the configuration file, but not in the UI.
fields.summary: Reloaded configuration file for CSV import does not remember custom field mappings in the import wizard

fields.description:
Issue navigator having problem filtering issues with a German character - *ß* for custom field values. The problem happened only to custom field which will stored its values in {{STRINGVALUE}} column in {{customfieldvalue}} table e.g. multi select custom field.

When a custom field's value with *ß* character e.g. *Gießen*, issue navigator won't find unless there's another value with *SS* replacing *ß* e.g. *Giessen*.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a multi select custom field
* Add two values for its option:
** Gießen 
** Giessen
* Associate the custom field to issue create screen (Default Screen)
* Create two issues with selected value *Gießen* and *Giessen* respectively
* Go to Issue Navigator and search for *Gießen* value for the custom field
** No issue will show up in the result
* Search for *Giessen*
** Two issues will show up(one with the value Gießen and another one with Giessen)
fields.summary: Issue navigator having problem filtering issues with a German character - ß for custom field values

fields.description:
JIRA should ship with issue linking on by default.  And we should define the standard issue link types.  We thought about this in the past but squibbed on the decision I think.

This would be for new customers only.  Existing customers would continue on un-changed.
fields.summary: Ship with Issue Linking On and Predefined Issue Link Types

fields.description:
# Change the {{jira-application.properties}} such that {{jira.projectkey.pattern = \(\[A-Z\].\+\)}}.
# Create a project called 'A각가' (these are just 
# (DEFECT) Create an issue in 'A각가'. Notice that the issue that you just created will report as not existing.
# Do a search in the issue navigator for all issues in 'A각가'. It will show the issue you just created.

The basic problem is that Tomcat 5/6 does not correctly decode the URLs. This will affect view issue, view project and some new features in 4.4.

To get this URL to decode correctly we need to specify the {{[URIEncoding|http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/config/http.html]}} property on the connector. We already specify {{useBodyEncodingForURI}} but this is not good enough in this case. I am not sure how these two options would operate together.
fields.summary: Project keys with non-latin characters do not work in URLs.
Clean up pages visited without the correct path

fields.description:
http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2011/04/sneak_preview_jira_44_linux_installer.html talks about the new JIRA installer. It looks like a good direction that will help lots of people, which is great!

But having installed JIRA at least a thousand times now and written installers for dozens of applications over the last ten years, I'm going ask for one thing: documentation of what the installer does. The current documentation is good, but please don't expect to replace it with a page saying "click this magic button".

Installers automate the manual installation steps very nicely, but sometimes I want to know *exactly* what was configured during an installation. I could extract the underlying JIRA package, unpack it and then diff the directories against what the installer has produced, but that's tedious and error-prone. Output from most installers is just not adequate to work out how to do a manual install.
fields.summary: The new installer still needs the manual install documentation

fields.description:
If you click "Create issue" in the upper navigation (Issues => Create Issue), you cannot choose anything from the selectbox Issue Type. This is br0ken for IE9. 

There are no problems if you go there by the "+ Create Issue" at the blue Navigation. 

Workaround: Using IE 7 or 8, Firefox 3.6.x, and Safari at this moment.
fields.summary: IE9: Selectbox Issue Type without content when creating issue

fields.description:
This is most likely a duplicate of another issue.
A one click update button would rock for confluence & jira !
I imagine that this is probably more "realistic" for the stand alone version of confluence and jira. 

(the button would update from $x version to $y later version).
fields.summary: a one click update button would rock!

fields.description: The Cascading select list first list of options is displayed and populated with values while the second corresponding values are empty and the field shrinks. This bug affects only IE9. See attached screen shot
fields.summary: The second option values in  cascading select list customfield is not populated on IE9

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Set up system locale as Deutsch (Deutschland).
# {{Administration > Global Settings > Time Tracking}}
# Deactivate time tracking, and set *Time Format* to _days_. Then, activate time tracking.
!German Time Tracking Bug 01 - Google Chrome.png|thumbnail!
# Reindex (if necessary).
# Create a new issue, with the *Original Estimate* set to _1d_.
!German Time Tracking Bug 02 - Google Chrome.png|thumbnail!
# Once the issue is created, proceed to edit the issue.
# Automatically, the value inside *Original Estimate* would be _1t_.
!German Time Tracking Bug 03 - Google Chrome.png|thumbnail!
# If you try to save the issue, error messages would appear stating that _*The original estimate specified is not valid.*_
!German Time Tracking Bug 04 - Google Chrome.png|thumbnail!
# You would have to change the value back to _1d_ to be able to save the issue.
|

h4. Workaround:
# {{Administration > Global Settings > Time Tracking}}
# Deactivate time tracking, and set *Time Format* to _pretty_. Then, activate time tracking.
fields.summary: German Time Tracking Format Prevents Saving of Issue
in java.net after create issue(reporting Bug), please give edit button if some one has entered by mistake while issue Bug|create issue

fields.description:
Project reports are broken if you only want a report for the last 24hrs. See:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?projectOrFilterId=project-10240&periodName=hourly&daysprevious=1&selectedProjectId=10240&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Aresolutiontime-report&Next=Next

Instead of getting 24 rows in the data table  (one for every hour ) you only get a few rows (depending on what time of day it is):

!report_hourly.png!
fields.summary: Missing data in project reports that only consider the last 24 hours

fields.description:
In firefox (3.5.18, maybe others), when using the keyboard left & right controls, the highlighted date will move two days. The correct behaviour is to move one day at a time.


|| Browser || Working correctly? ||
| Firefox 3.5.18 | (x) |
| Firefox 3.6.14 | (x) |
| Chrome | (/) |
fields.summary: Using keyboard to navigate calendar popup moves 2 days at a time

fields.description:
If you have GreenHopper installed, the list of gadgets availble in the "Views->On Dashboard" dialog (from the issue nav) does not fit in the dialog. The dialog does not scroll and the gadget names run off the bottom of the dialog and the page.

!ViewOnDashboard.png!

Reproduces in all browsers I tried (IE8, Safari 5, FireFox 3.6)
fields.summary: Views->On Dashboard dialog does not scroll

Tested on Chrome 10.0.648.204 on Mac OS X.

fields.summary: Changing the project email address results in a 404 error

fields.description:
Hi,

I just setup JIRA 4.4, configured a mail server during the setup process, then create a new project. The new project used "None" as the notification scheme instead of using the "Default Notification Scheme"
fields.summary: The default notification scheme is "None" instead of the "Default Notification Scheme"
"Test Connection" in the JIRA email setup process should give better feedback

fields.description:
See this issue: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-3918

In this case, the customer was using the default screen for the transition, which included the ability to update the issue type.  We were progressing this transition in response to a commit message from SVN, and were updating none of the fields, however, JIRA seems to be ignoring the fact that no issue type was set on the transition request, and updates the issue type of the issue to be null.  This later results in a NullPointerException when permissions are checked for another field.

This may be a problem for other fields, not sure.  It seems here that the assumption is that because issue type is a select list, that it will always have a value.  That's true when the transition is executed from the web interface, but its not true in any other workflow transition scenario.  It also seems that the issue type field might not be being correctly validated before being set.  What should happen is that it should be seen to be null in the transition request, and so not updated.
fields.summary: When a transition has a screen that contains the issue type, JIRA updates the issue type to null if it's not set on the transition

fields.description:
The LocalGadgetSpecFactory hangs onto a cache of CacheableGadgetSpec objects, which is updated when a plugin's modified date is after the date at which we put it into the cache.

As these objects are loaded via the plugin's class loader (as far as we are aware), this will block the destruction of the plugin's class loader on plugin uninstall.

This may potentially lead to ClassCastExceptions in the future.

One could first verify that this is an issue by using YourKit to take a memory dump after uninstalling a plugin, and determining if the plugin's class loader is still in memory.

This was found by Ian Grunert during his plugins reload work.  Its a problem thats been there for a while but we are unsure of its impact.
fields.summary: LocalGadgetSpecFactory may potentially block destruction of gadget plugin class loader
